data.title: Southeast Edmonton Homes For Sale
data.text:
Browse Real Estate and Southeast Edmonton Listings By Community

Southeast Edmonton Real Estate Market

Southeast Edmonton Home Styles

Southeast Edmonton has plenty to offer Edmonton home buyers in terms of home style and price point. These include large luxury properties, front and rear detached single-family homes, duplexes, townhomes and apartment-style condos.

Newer homes built over the last then years tend to be the most common real estate option in Southwest Edmonton. Still, there are plenty of older, upgraded character properties to choose from – especially in areas closer to Southeast Central Edmonton.

Apartment-style condos in Southeast Edmonton can be found for as little as $75,000 and as much as $300,000 depending. Single-family homes are also broadly priced and can be purchased anywhere from the low 200s to the multi-millions. Even with the area’s many higher-priced luxury properties, Southeast Edmonton offers fantastic affordability and value.

Southeast Edmonton Communities

Southeast Edmonton is comprised of several larger districts, each hosting a variety of unique neighbourhoods. These include Decoteau, Ellerslie and The Meadows.

Decoteau is the newest district to be included in Southeast Edmonton, with its neighbourhoods still under development. Plans for the area include five communities in total, which will offer buyers a broad range of home styles and amenities. The site is also said to house Edmonton’s most extensive wetlands complex.

Note: Mill Woods and Southeast Central Edmonton are also considered to be part of greater Southeast Edmonton. More information on these exclusive areas can be found under Communities.

Southeast Edmonton Amenities

Shops and Services

Southeast Edmonton is known for its accessibility and proximity to shops and services, the most famous of which may be South Edmonton Common. Mill Woods Town Centre and the Grey Nuns Hospital can also be found in the heart of Southeast Edmonton’s Mill Woods district.

Grey Nuns Community Hospital

Mill Woods Town Centre

Rio Can Meadows

South Edmonton Common

Southgate Centre

The Shops and Summerside

Parks and Recreation

Southeast Edmonton offers no shortage of indoor and outdoor recreational opportunities. These encompass a variety of recreation centres throughout (including the brand-new Meadows Recreation Centre) and unique community features such as Summerside Lake.

Other popular Southeast Edmonton recreational amenities include:

Ivor Dent Sports Park

Jackie Parker Park

The Meadows Community Recreation Centre

Mill Woods Golf Course

Mill Woods Recreation Centre

Mill Woods Sports Park

Summerside Lake

Southeast Edmonton Schools

A great place to raise a family, Southeast Edmonton hosts a significant number of schools and educational options for children of all ages. These include Public, Catholic and other non-secular schools as well as bilingual and immersion programs, preschools, daycares and more.

Commuting From Southeast Edmonton

Southeast Edmonton is bounded by several major thoroughfares. The most popular of these commuter roads include Calgary Trail/Gateway Boulevard/Hwy 2, which make commuting to downtown Edmonton and the Edmonton International Airport a breeze.

In addition, Whitemud Drive and the south Anthony Henday both transect this quadrant of the city, providing streamlined access to the greater City of Edmonton and surrounding areas.

While routes are still developing in Southeast Edmonton’s up-and-coming communities, transit remains incredibly accessible area’s more established neighbourhoods. The city’s future Valley LRT line is also planned for Southeast Edmonton, operating from Mill Woods to the West end.

Major transit centres in the area include:

Lakewood Transit Centre

Meadows Transit Centre

Mill Woods Transit Centre
